hackathon-description-text: HackHERS is the annual, women-centric hackathon at Rutgers University, organized by Rutgers Women in Computer Science and The Douglass Project. We want to create a space in which women can explore tech culture and be empowered to create with code, and we invite everyone to help us achieve that.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: We love seeing women empowering other women through technology! Whether it’s for equality in the workplace, women’s health, or anything else you can think of, this prize category is for women helping each other <3
Everyone has to start somewhere! For all the people who came here just starting to code, we encourage you to keep building things and learning. This is just the start of a truly rewarding journey.
Hackathons aren’t all work and no play. This prize is for the inner class clown in you! Win something silly to take home by making us laugh until we fall :)
In honor of Valentine's Day earlier this week! This prize will go to the team that makes the best Valentine's Day-themed hack at HackHERS.
Make the next awesome, viral video game! From puzzle games, to narrative games, the possibilities in game development are endless and we welcome all kinds of games to enter into this prize category!
Does your hack have a really cool interface? Then enter your hack to win Best Design!
A hack that is just plain awesome.

Use your tech skills for good and hack online harassment. Build a software solution that can help reduce the frequency and/or severity of online harassment. Winners will get Hack Harassment Battery Packs.
Capital One is giving out $200 Amazon gift cards for each member of the winning team with the best use of their API, Nessie.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Use of Nessie - Capital One

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The winning team that hacks something for social good will receive Bose headphones for each team member.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Social Good Hack - JP Morgan & Chase
